intro: Hesperoxiphion niveum, commonly known as the white tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow ray flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hesperoxiphion niveum is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
